src:
KNOW SHOWS: What's on in Regina, Nov. 7-13
“Kim Churchill is an astounding one-man show from Australia,” and he's performing in Regina this week.
07 Nov 2019, 13:00 by Ashley Martin



National musical treasure Jann Arden performs at the Conexus Arts Centre on Thursday, Nov. 7, 7:30 p.m. Tickets start at $49.
—
If you like The Bros. Landreth, you probably like Ariel Posen, who will be playing roots-rock music at the Exchange on Thursday, Nov. 7, 7:30 p.m. $12 cover.
—
All the way from Winnipeg, Sean Burns plays classic country and classic-sounding original songs at the Fat Badger on Thursday, Nov. 7, 8 p.m. This time, he’s joined by Skinny Dyck and Paul Holden.
—
More than 70 Saskatchewan artists will be selling their wares at WinterGreen Fine Craft Market, taking place at the Conexus Arts Centre, Friday, Nov. 8, 1-9 p.m., Saturday, Nov. 9, 10 a.m.-6 p.m., and Sunday, Nov. 10, 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Admission is $5 for adults.
—
There’s an artist talk and opening reception for Marigold Santos’ MALAGINTO on Friday, Nov. 8, 6 p.m. in the RPL Film Theatre and Dunlop (Central) Art Gallery. Through art, Santos “returns to the memories associated with her family’s immigration from the Philippines to Canada in the late 80’s as an auto-biographical point of departure, and considers the experiences of a young person coming to terms with a new sense of self in relation to their new environment.”
—
Now, here’s a sales pitch! “Kim Churchill is an astounding one-man show from Australia. Watch virtuosic performances of electrifying indie-folk and acoustic blues songs from a one-man tour-de-force. His song ‘Second Hand Car’ is an undeniable earworm,” writes Dana Rempel, managing director at The Artesian, where Churchill performs Friday, Nov. 8, 7 p.m. B.C. folk duo Ocie Elliot, who performed in February with Carmanah, opens the show. Tickets are $15.
—
The Regina Symphony Orchestra presents Missing, an opera about missing and murdered Indigenous women, at the Regina Performing Arts Centre on Friday, Nov. 8 and Saturday, Nov. 9. Tickets are $25 for adults at reginasymphony.com.
—
Unfazed celebrates music fans of all ages with a rock show at the Club side of the Exchange on Friday, Nov. 8, 8 p.m. $10 cover.
—
Rock Is Dead is a tribute to legendary rock and roll. The band includes Amanda Schenstead, Ben Redant, Carter Powley and many others, plus a bunch of guest singers. They perform at The Exchange on Friday, Nov. 8, and Saturday, Nov. 9, 7:30 p.m. It’s also a fundraiser for MusicHeals. Tickets are $20 per night, or $30 for a two-night pass.
—
ecoaborijanelle, a.k.a. Janelle Pewapsconias, is the featured artist at a Word Up poetry slam on Friday, Nov. 8, 8 p.m. at the Creative City Centre. Admission is $10 plus GST. Note, the venue is up two long flights of stairs and there is no elevator or chair lift.
—
Chris Sleightholm (Snake River) is having an album release party at T+A Vinyl on Friday, Nov. 8. His music has English folk, country and 60s psych influences. Sharing the bill, Amber Goodwyn and Piper Burns collaborate as Dialtone. $10 at the door. Music starts at 9 p.m.
—
The Lincoln Loggers (lumberjack-themed music) and Lunar Lander Dance Commander (dance rock) are playing at The Cure on Friday, Nov. 8, 9 p.m. Their music accompanies a screening of the 1993 film Fire in the Sky (creepy alien abduction story).
—
There’s karaoke at Broadway’s Lounge on Friday, Nov. 8, 9 p.m.
—
Tyler Gilbert plays hard-rock music at O’Hanlon’s on Friday, Nov. 8, 11 p.m.
—
The Cathedral Area Community Association is holding it’s annual Holiday Craft Market on Saturday, Nov. 9, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. More than 80 crafters will be selling their wares in two locations, the Cathedral Neighbourhood Centre (2900 13th Ave.) and Westminster United Church (3025 13th Ave.). Admission is free, but donations to CACA are appreciated.
—
Visit Bushwakker on Saturday, Nov. 9, 3 p.m., to hear local authors Carol Rose GoldenEagle, Raye Hendrickson, Mark Cote, gillian harding-russell, Shane Arbuthnott and Randy Lundy read some of their work.
—
There’s a jam at Broadway’s Lounge on Saturday, Nov. 9, 4-8 p.m., followed by Code Blue at 9 p.m.
—
Garage rock band Pop Pop Vernac is having a release party for its first ever CD, Loud Local Band. Midnight Gallows and Paige Drobot open the show, which happens Saturday, Nov. 9, 8 p.m. at the Mercury.
—
Pierre Guitard plays shoegazey musique en francais at the Hilton DoubleTree on Saturday, Nov. 9, 8:30 p.m. Tickets are $20 for adults — more if you want to partake in supper and a show.
—
Randy Woods Band (formerly Absofunkinlutely) plays soul, reggae, and groove music at Revival Music Room on Saturday, Nov. 9, 9 p.m.
—
Dirty Poncho, VODI3, Philly Flex, Lil Crack, and IDONTEVENEXIST perform a hip-hop show on Saturday, Nov. 9, 8 p.m. at the Exchange. $10 cover.
—
JUNO award-winning singer-songwriter Steve Bell is making a solo appearance in Regina on Sunday, Nov. 10, 7 p.m. at Holy Child Parish (2636 7th Ave. E.). Tickets are $20 and available at stevebell.com/events, through Burns Hanley Church Supplies, and at Holy Child Parish.
—
Scott Pettigrew and Tayler Tluchak perform at Revival Music Room on Sunday, Nov. 10, 8 p.m. $10 cover.
—
Side By Side Quartet presents Lest We Forget: Songs From the War Years on Sunday, Nov. 10, and Monday, Nov. 11, 7:30 p.m. at The Artesian. Tickets are $20 and are available in person at Dancer’s Den, online at artesianon13th.ca, and at the door.
—
The Alley Dawgs (and special guests) celebrate 20th-century country music every Tuesday at 9:30 p.m. sharp at the Fat Badger. Admission is free.
—
UR Improv hosts the fourth annual Centre of Plains International Improv Festival. Teams from Regina, the Prairies and beyond perform during four nights, starting Wednesday, Nov. 13, 7 p.m. at the U of R Riddell Centre Shu-Box Theatre. Admission is by donation and there’s a $5 cash bar ($4 if you bring your own cup).
—
Lemon Bucket Orkestra is described as Toronto’s only Balkan-Klezmer-Gypsy-Party-Punk Super-Band, and its 12-piece lineup includes Regina expat Ian Tulloch on sousaphone. The band performs in Regina on Wednesday, Nov. 13, 8 p.m. at the Artesian. Tickets are $27 in advance at artesianon13th.ca, and $33 at the door.
—
Dave Grandel, Scott Anthony Andrews and Jaecy Bells perform for Wednesday Night Folk at Bushwakker, Wednesday at 8 p.m.
—
Big Wreck performs Wednesday, Nov. 13, 8 p.m. at the Casino Regina Show Lounge. So get ready to sing all the words to “Blown Wide Open,” “That Song” and “The Oaf.” Tickets start at $40.

KNOW SHOWS highlights some of the awesome arts-based events going on in Regina. Let us know about your show — email amartin@postmedia.com.
